title: Alpha Client Replay Feature
body: I was wondering if this feature is coming later in the patch or in the upcoming patch. I cannot find the replay feature at all.

replies.body:
Hey i have a question
After i actually found the Replays in my computer i have them here but the problem is my computer cant really replay them. Like theres no program for it, i tried all of i have but still cant replay, is there any program i actually need to replay my plays?
@Unicorn108 I was wondering that too. I used google chrome.

I played last night and was able to access Replays. When you leave a game, there's a small arrow icon at the top of the client when in the post-game screen. That allows you to download your replay. You can then click the same icon to watch the replay.

Or, you can go to your profile and in match history, the arrow icons for download/play are next to any eligible game.

Since this is Alpha, maybe certain features are being A/B tested and your client isn't there yet. But take another look.

I also looked quickly for a repository for downloaded replays in the client and couldn't find one. I assume you'll be able to access this through a folder somewhere on your drive, though.
Awesome!  I'd say that's actually pretty intuitive.  :D Thanks for the level up!

I don't really have any details or ETA on replays beyond what's been provided in the [2017 summary.](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/featured/preseason-2017/replays-and-practice)  Bookmark our [News](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/) page to stay up to date on these features going live.  If you have any questions or feedback as well, share it with the community on the [Client](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/alpha-client-discussion) boards.  Hope that helps!

You can find your replays in this folder, see path

**C:\Users\User\Documents\League of Legends\Replays**

I really hop there will be a tab in the profile section where u can see your downloaded replays
